intro: Hieracium erythrocaulon, commonly known as the red-stemmed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are reddish in color, giving it its common name. Hieracium erythrocaulon produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
